li.a: ESSA Title One Parent Resource Information
NSBA - School Boards in the Digital Age
Social Media Guidelines for Board Members
Report Card and Progress Report Dates

div.p: Effective Monday, March 16, all schools in the Parsippany-Troy Hills Township School District were closed through March 27. Our school closure will be extended for several more weeks. All NJ schools are closed under Executive Order #104 of the Governor and cannot re-open without the restrictions being lifted on public schools. As long as COVID-19 cases are increasing in NJ, schools will certainly remain closed. It will most likely take several consecutive weeks for the number of cases to drop in NJ before opening is even a consideration. Therefore, we should expect to continue our Distance Learning through at least April 17th and I will communicate additional information at that time. All extracurricular and school-related activities and events are suspended during this time. We will continue to monitor all events associated with the Covid-19 pandemic and follow the guidance of our local Health Officials and the NJ Department of Health.

td.p:
Board of Education Meeting
Thursday, April 30, 2020, 7:00PM

div.p: Please be reminded that if your child was eligible for meal benefits as of June 30, 2019, he/she will continue to receive benefits until October 16, 2019. To continue to receive benefits after October 16th, a new application must be submitted. The on-line meal application is available through Genesis (click on the "forms" tab while on the Parent Access screen). You may also print out the application or request a paper application from your child's school. Go to our Food Services page for more information.

div.p: The Parsippany Troy-Hills School District is a K-12 district with fourteen schools serving a population of approximately 7200 students in ten elementary schools, two middle schools, two high schools and an adult education center. The community served by the district is ethnically, culturally and linguistically diverse.
